bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 206 (Thursday, December 14, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. CASTRO of Texas:H.R. 6797.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Congressman Joaquin CastroConstitutional Authority--Necessary and Proper Clause (Art.I, Sec. 8, Clause 18)THE U.S. CONSTITUTION ARTICLE I, SECTION 8: POWERS OFCONGRESS CLAUSE 18The Congress shall have power . . . To make all laws whichshall be necessary and proper forThe single subject of this legislation is:To improve US leadership at the United Nations and othermultilateral institutions[Page H6986]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

bill.title: Restoring U.S. Leadership in International Organizations Act of 2023

item.title: Restoring U.S. Leadership in International Organizations Act of 2023
Restoring U.S. Leadership in International Organizations Act of 2023
To provide for enhanced United States leadership at international organizations, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
